p: Secondary metabolites are biomolecules produced for sustainability or adaptation of plants in the environment as a result of many factors, such as protection from drought, pollination, and predation, but are not required for immediate survival of the plants [ 17]. Secondary metabolites and pigments, because of their healing effects in humans are processed into drugs such as inulin (dahlias plant), morphine and codeine (poppy plant), quinine (cinchona plant), and digoxin (foxglove plant) [ 18].
